== Vitajte ==
Vítame vás na <nowiki>[[http://ubuntugnome.org/help-with-testing/ | oficiálnej dokumentácii]]</nowiki> pre vydania určené na vývoj a testovanie. '''Venujte tejto stránke maximálnu pozornosť.'''

 
== Testovanie ==
Nižšie uvedené obrazy nie sú určené pre produkčné prostredie. Viac sa dočítate v <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1594833 | sekcii častých otázok okolo testovania]]</nowiki>.

=== Predtým ako začnete ===
==== Som tu nový. ? ====
Congratulation, you are the best candidate who actually can help us testing a development release. If you are new to all this, please read '''<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/ISO/Walkthrough | this page]]</nowiki>'''. If you have any question, join the mailing list and just ask :)

----
==== Important Notes ====
Testing and using Development Releases of Ubuntu GNOME (or any other flavor of Ubuntu) isn't meant to be for production machines of daily usage. Testing is to make sure the Stable Release is working as good as possible. Find Bugs, Improve Performance, etc - this is what we do until we finalize the testing process and release a stable version. Whenever you are testing, keep in mind few notes:

# Make sure to <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BackupYourSystem | Backup]]</nowiki> your '''important data'''. If you are using Linux, the best and easier way is to make a copy of your '''/home''' folder or partition. If you want to do a full system backup, please see <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BackupYourSystem | Backup Your System]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://www.howtogeek.com/108869/how-to-back-up-ubuntu-the-easy-way-with-dj-dup/ | this link too]]</nowiki>.
# You can use <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virtual_machine | Virtual Machines]]</nowiki> - for example <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/VirtualMachines | See this]]</nowiki>. You can use USB Drives or External HDD. You can use your machine. That is totally up to you but please, refer to #1 :)
# Using a Development Release is not suitable for daily production machine.
# The more you break your installation, the better. That is why, to play it safe, better to use Virtual Machines, Spare Testing Machines and/or USB Drives, specially with Alpha 1 and Alpha 2. Beta Releases are a bit more stable but still under heavy development.
# '''The most important part of testing is to actually install the system and check how the installation process will work'''. This is very important. Please, do a fresh new install - you can either <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/ZsyncCdImage | zsync]]</nowiki> your ISO or download again.
# Finally, always remember: '''Better Safe Than Sorry''' :)

----
==== Ubuntu GNOME QA Mailing List ====
Once you join Ubuntu GNOME QA Sub-Team, you will be <nowiki>[[https://help.launchpad.net/Teams/MailingLists | subscribed to the mailing list]]</nowiki> of Ubuntu GNOME QA Team.

----
==== Share Your Findings or Ask Qs ====
It is '''VERY''' important to share your findings with the team. Also, you can ask anything on the mailing list as well. So, it is a must-do step :)

-----

=== Testing Help and Support ===

* There are several ways to ask for help and/or support when it comes to Testing Ubuntu GNOME.

----
==== QA Mailing List ====

1. '''For Ubuntu GNOME specific Questions and Testing Support''': Ubuntu GNOME QA Team - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntugnome-qa | Mailing List]]</nowiki>

1. '''For ''General Ubuntu'' Questions and Testing Support''': Ubuntu Quality Team - <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/QATeam/Contact | Mailing List]]</nowiki>

----
==== Ubuntu Forums ====

* For Questions and Support, you may want to use <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/forumdisplay.php?f=427 | Ubuntu Forums Ubuntu +1 Section]]</nowiki>.

* When you start a '''new thread''', please make sure to use the proper tag:

<nowiki>[[File:forums.png]]</nowiki>

<<BR>>

* '''Please Note''': <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/forumdisplay.php?f=427 | This forum]]</nowiki> is for the discussion of the development of the next version of Ubuntu. Please Note: Ubuntu Developers do not usually read the forums, If you run into what you think is a bug, please use Launchpad to report it.

----
==== IRC ====

1. '''For Ubuntu GNOME specific Questions and Testing Support''':  Ubuntu GNOME Channel on <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuGNOME/ContactUs#Live_Chat | IRC]]</nowiki>

1. '''For ''General Ubuntu'' Questions and Testing Support''': Ubuntu Quality Channel on <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/QATeam/Contact | IRC]]</nowiki>
